poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The waitress - she looked fierce and sounded Polish. Menu, chalked on a board behind her head, Long as the queue behind me. To save time I said 'what do you have for breakfast?' she said 'What did I have for breakfast!?!?' - 'no, wait A lime soda, to go.' What would I get? A lindenflower ptisane? A Bicarbonate and lunar caustic shake? See Brexit? I don't know about you
